docs.lead_paragraph: As money gets tighter, a child's world gets narrower. "Many kids would go down south on the train for the summer, to grandparents or relatives. Now, nobody has the money to send them," said Eleanor D. Minus, who helps Harlem children go to Fresh Air Fund camps or homes for the summer.

headline.main: Need for Fresh Air Fund Increases With Inflation

docs.abstract: article on work of United Methodist Camp Service and Staten Island Mental Health Soc, which are referral agencies for Fresh Air Fund (M)
